result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Jeremy Ted Peterson was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 2.
Concurrent without prejudice to consecutive if revoked. 
Court notes 5 days credit against ultimate sentence.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

miscConds.notes: Apply bond on file and balance of $2464.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF364.

Bond applied to DNA surcharge.
$85.50 Blood Draw to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF364.

-If accepted into Drug Court Defendant to successfully complete the program.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Random and regular testing.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-Court authorizes a Furlough for October 27, 2015 - neurology appointment. To be released to fiance' for appointment and go directly to appointment and return right after appointment with no stops to the St. Croix County Jail.
-Defendant will be tested prior to release and upon return from appointment.

Good time granted against condition time.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY: Joel Kenneth Larimore DF:  Jeremy Ted Peterson appeared. Case called at 8:17. Includes 15CF38, 15CF258, 14CF364. ADA Hartung updates the court. Atty. Larimorre agrees.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1  in 14CF364 and to the amended charge of misdemeanor DC in 15CF258. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. DE acknowledges priors. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 14CF364 and to the amended charge of misdemeanor DC in 15CF258. On motion of the State, Crt merge and dismisses with out objection Ct. 2 in 14CF364 and dismisses 15CF38. Atty's waive PSI. Sentencing arguments. DE has completed the information for Drug Court. DE makes statement. Crt orders: Sentence W/H on 14CF364  
3 years probation Probation is concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation.
- 12 months St. Croix County Jail  3 months STAYED.
  Court notes 5 days credit against any ultimate sentence. 
  Huber granted for work and seek work.
  Good time granted against condition time.
 - 36 mo. DL revocation
  Credit for any administrative suspension.
- 36 mo. IID
- $3214.00 inclusive of costs
    apply bond on file.
- $85.50 for blood draw
- AODA and any recommended follow through.

- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times . This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Random and regular testing. 
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.

On 15CF258 W/H 1 year probation
- Costs
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
